issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: ContainerLocalizer or ResourceLocalizationService will use the ReadWriteDiskValidator as its disk validator when it downloads files if we configure the yarn.nodemanger.disk-validator to ReadWriteDiskValidator's name. In that case, ReadWriteDiskValidator will create a metric item for each directory localized, which will be too many metrics. We should let ContainerLocalizer only use the basic disk validator.
fields.summary: Too many metrics if containerLocalizer/ResourceLocalizationService uses ReadWriteDiskValidator

Agree that expensive disk checking should only be performed at a disk level, rather than at an individual directory level. I have kicked off another jenkins build to see if the mvn-install issue is transient.
